author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request met all of the guidelines for auto-merging and is scheduled to be merged when the mandatory waiting period (3 days) has elapsed.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have read the package naming guidelines: https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->

@timmyfaraday this package seems to do very little.  [`UnitfulCurrency.jl`](https://github.com/bhgomes/UnitfulCurrency.jl) looks more comprehensive as far currencies are concerned (but it's archived), and @rmsrosa has a more actively developed implementation in [`UnitfulCurrencies.jl`](https://github.com/rmsrosa/UnitfulCurrencies.jl).  I think it's better to join the forces instead of registering half-baked packages?  Or do you prefer to go on anyway with the registration of `AdditionalUnits.jl`?

Hi @giordano,

Currently, it is indeed very limited. However, it is the intend to add a lot more in the area of energy systems.
I will add a disclaimer to the read-me to point out that certain packages may be more appropriate for specific subdomains, e.g., currencies. 

I would however like to go on with the registration of this package.

with kind regards,

Tom Van Acker

[noblock]
